values: I've made a new LJ community called <lj user="VintageVideo">.  I'll post interesting and fun retro videos that I find all over the interwebs for anyone to enjoy.  Please join!  <3

I'm basically working to pay medical bills for the next 100 years.  Mercy South owns my first born child.  Bronchitis is finally clearing up and I can breathe again.

On a good note: I do get 2 of my 3 meds for FREE now.  :)

Loving this fall weather.  <3

Moral: Get your boss drunk, and he will give you a raise. Make sure is a Busch!

After getting your boss all drunked up, be sure to enjoy a Winston.

Those crazy 1950's and 60's.
It is harder than I though going from non-stop roller sets to ALL haircuts.  I am learning a lot though...even how to fade.  Its intimidating and makes me nervous.

It's easy for people to be asked their favorite music/bands and for them to immediately list off whatever bands they think suit their persona, or whatever their current band of the week is. Maybe you really do like those bands, but there are a whole lot more that you aren't telling us about. There is music lurking on your mp3 player that you know you jam to, sing, dance to when no one is around to hear it and maybe even when they are. The Shuffle Challenge: Set your player to shuffle whether it be on your mp3 player or computer and list the first 100 (YES A HUNDRED) songs that come up without skipping any because you might be embarassed or think it's silly. Why so many? Because it gives a good chance of delving into all the types of music you really enjoy whereas 5-10 would just scratch the surface. If something ridiculous comes on and you feel like you have to explain it, go ahead. We're not judging you. Ready GO! 1. Emergency - Paramore 2. Cry Baby Cry - The Beatles 3. No Dough - The Mamas & The Papas 4. Dream Lover - Bobby Darin 5. She'll Be There - The Monkees 6. 50's Medley - The Monkees 7. Walking The Dog - The Rolling Stones 8. I'm Sorry - Flyleaf 9. When The Day Met The Night - PANIC! at the Disco 10. Ticket To Ride - The Beatles 11. The Fame - Lady GaGa 12. Dreams - Fleetwood Mac 13. Where Do Broken Hearts Go? - Whitney Houston 14. Come Together - Michael Jackson (cover) 15. Brick House - The Commodores (Hells. Yeah.) 16. Write You A Song - Plain White T's 17. Move Over - Janis Joplin 18. Make Love In This Club - Usher (LOL.) 19. Me and Bobby McGee - Janis Joplin 20. Pretty Little Head - Paul McCartney 21. I Wanna Be Free - The Monkees 22. 1921 - The Who (I really don't listen to the Tommy album that much.) 23. We're Not Gonna Take It - The Who (LOL. Again.) 24. My Cherie Amore - Stevie Wonder (I love ANYTHING by him.) 25. Heart and Soul - The Monkees (I guess you can tell who my fav is.) :) 26. Too Hot Ta Trot - The Commodores 27. A String of Pearls - Glenn Miller Orchestra 28. The Day We Fall in Love - The Monkees 29. The Best - Tina Turner 30. Kozmic Blues - Janis Joplin 31. My Generation - The Who 32. California Girls - The Beach Boys 33. Overload - Alfie Zappacosta (Dirty Dancing Sdtk.) 34. Don't Stop To Watch The Wheels - The Doobie Bros. 35. Somebody Groovy - The Mamas & The Papas 36. Come Back To Me - Janet Jackson (I have her entire discography. LOVE her.) 37. Well Through Out Twinkles - Silversun Pickups 38. Smoke Detector - Rilo Kiley 39. Run Run Run - The Velvet Underground (& Nico) 40. Crying - Roy Orbison (I haven't listened to him much lately...) 41. Lady Of The Valley - Michael Nesmith (<3<3<3) 42. Ditty Diego (War Chant) - The Monkees 43. She's My Baby - The Traveling Wilburys 44. Mumbo Link - Paul McCartney & Wings 45. Faith - George Michaels (YES!) 46. Pretty Boy - Danity Kane (Don't judge me, sometimes I just have to get down.) 47. Peachy - Family Force 5 48. I Remember Nothing - Joy Division 49. Touching My Body - Danity Kane 50. Roll Over Beethoven - The Beatles (I listen to this at least once a week.) 51. Sloop John B - The Beach Boys 52. Lose Urself - Family Force 5 53. Busted Down Around O'Connelly Corners - The Doobie Bros. 54. Beautiful Night - Paul McCartney 55. A Woman Left Lonely - Janis Joplin 56. Louie Louie - Paul Revere & The Raiders 57. U Started It - Gwen Stefani 58. Last Dance - Donna Summer (LOVE me some disco!) 59. White Lightning & Wine - Heart 60. Are You Happy Now? - Michelle Branch 61. Baby, Baby, Baby - TLC 62. Wheels of Fortune - The Doobie Bros. 63. Die Die Die - The Avett Brothers 64. Angel - Leona Lewis 65. Momma Miss America - Paul McCartney 66. Can't Help Falling In Love With You - Elvis Presley 67. More I Cannot Wish You - Guys and Dolls movie sdtk. 68. Anyway - Paul McCartney 69. Catch Me Daddy (Live) - Big Brother & The Holding Company 70. Bold As Love - John Mayer 71. I Feel Fine - The Beatles 72. Use Somebody - Kings of Leon (This gets stuck in my head SO much.) 73. Michio's Death Drive - Minus The Bear 74. Watching The Wheels - John Lennon & Yoko Ono 75. Bixby, Canyon Bridge - Death Cab for Cutie 76. I'm Moving On - John Lennon & Yoko Ono 77. Whatever Will Be Will Be (Que Sera Sera) - Doris Day 78. You The Tops feat. Frank Sinatra - Ethel Merman (<3<3<3) 79. Without Love - Bon Jovi 80. Photograph - Shiny Toy Guns 81. All My Loving - Across The Universe Sdtk. 82. Eyes Like Twins - Wilson Phillips 83. Piece Of My Heart - Janis Joplin 84. God Only Knows - The Beach Boys 85. My Heart Will Go On - Celine Dion 86. Hey Mickey - Toni Basil 87. Whiskey Lullaby feat. Allison Krauss - Brad Paisley 88. Plans - Bloc Party 89. Close Call - Rilo Kiley 90. USC Trojans - Drumlines (I love listening to drumlines...band geek.) 91. Be-Bop-A-Lula - John Lennon (cover) 92. Silver Moon - Michael Nesmith 93. Autographs & Apologies - Motion City Soundtrack 94. Heart of Stone - Cher 95. Atmosphere - Joy Division 96. Low - Kelly Clarkson 97. Fame < Infamy - Fall Out Boy 98. See Fernando - Jenny Lewis 99. Bizarre Love Triangle - New Order 100. Vogue - Madonna I'm bummersauced that some people didn't even make the list: Aerosmith, Aretha Franklin, Billy Ocean, Buffalo Springfield, Chuck Berry, CCR, Earth Wind and Fire, Eisley, Etta James, OCMS, Pierce the Veil, Thao with The Get Down Stay Down, or Yeah Yeah Yeahs. BIG NEWS - My sister scored FREE tickets to the CHICAGO and EARTH WIND & FIRE concert next month. I. CAN'T. WAIT.
BIG NEWS AGAIN - I recieved some paperwork from my gastro doctor today, and I could get my Humira shots for FREE, or at a discounted price! I can also get my Nexium at an affordable price! I'm just praying that my paperwork is accepted. No creepy drug stud for me! (Hopefully.)

Feeling sickish.  I really like this band, I just heard them for the first time a few weeks ago:

<center><lj-embed id="19"/>

I finally graduated on June 23rd, and I have a job at Great Clips.  My state board test is on August 5th.  I've been trying to study like crazy...but I usually get distracted.  Its SOOO much to remember.  About 15 chapters full of information that I most likely won't even need to know at my job.  I'll be doing haircuts, haircuts, and some more haircuts.

I'm really excited to start working full time so I can save up money to finally MOVE OUT!  I'm ready for my OWN place.  Not sure if I'll try to find a roommate yet.  The thought of being alone all night kinda freaks me out.  I'm a big wuss in the dark...I don't like to be home alone at night here.  I'm also afraid to live with a friend, because I'm afraid we would drive each other crazy.  Not that I find any of my friends annoying, its just when you live with someone and you're around each other more than you used to be...its different.  Don't want anymore drama.  Most of my friends have already got their own place anyway...so I'll probably be flying solo!  

I won't get my new health insurance for 90 days a great clips, so I've been without for a few weeks now.  I can't afford the Humira shot (Its a couple THOUSAND $$$ for 2 shots) so I have to join a drug study.  I'm a little nervous to join and have a brand new drug tested on me...but ya gotta do whatcha gotta do, right?  Hopefully the meds work as well as the Humira or better.  My Nexium and Mercaptopurine cost about $600 for both of them.  Thank goodness Dad got my last refills for me.  I can't believe they charge that much for a one month supply of meds!  My Crohns hasn't bothered me in awhile, so thats also a blessing.

BTW...anyone notice my groovy new mood theme?  :)
30 Ways To Paint Your Cat. http://adpics.info/30-painted-cats.html

I will graduate around the third week of June. Its about damn time! I hate it when a black client asks me, "Have you ever done ethnic hair?" No ma'am...I've only been here for 3 years, in Springdale, in a primarily african-american area, and I'm sure I've seen you before...I'm just the receptionist. Puttin' rollers in your hair isn't rocket science. Bake sale tomorrow at Kroger for Team LOVE. I've never seen our kitchen so full o' treats. Come down to the Fairfield Kroger and have some sweets! :)
Whoa there, Zombiecake! Lets make these.

Sprinkles was put to sleep today. My heart has been ripped right outta my chest cavity. I'll never forget her, and I'll always miss her coming into my room at night and sleeping right up in my face.
<3 <3 <3

I can eat regular foods again!  PICC line comes out saturday!  1600 hours at school after tomorrow!  Dad's retirement suprise tomorrow!  <3

Cheese ravioli is heaven.

Well, things have been pretty shittastic.

I was admitted to the hospital for about a week.  They put a picc line in, which is a really big drag.  Now I'm on the TPN again and can't eat.  I went to the dr today, and I have a scope on wednesday morning.  The new opening in my stomach that they made back in August is closed up, so they are going to try and stretch it back out.  The procedure is one that I've had a billion times, but it is scarier this time because there is a change they could cause a perforation from the balloon trying to stretch out my stomach.  Hopefully everything will go alright and it will work, then I can get this fucking line out of my arm and join the "people who can eat regular food" club again.

I registered a team to walk for the Crohn's and Colitis Foundation of America walk next month at Sawyer Point.  A big thanks to everyone who has joined the team!  I'm hoping we raise at least $125 before May 31st.  It feels good to help out an organization that is trying to help me and everyone else struggling with this illness...even my cat.

Back to school tomorrow!

Spending a sunday reading a historical fiction novel in bed, cruising the web, and listening to The Beatles. Looking out the small hole in my blinds and seeing one single leaf dangling on the tree outside. The birds are starting to sing again. Driving with the windows down and blasting Buffalo Springfield while chain smoking Marlboros. Browsing through used books and finding one that really excites me and that I can't wait to start reading. Laying on the couch watching old movies with the front door open so the breeze blows in, while Sprinkles lays on my chest and purrs. I can hear the neighborhood kids laughing in the first warm weather on the edge of spring. Laughing with friends who I haven't gotten to see much lately, doodling on Mac's napkins, and talking through a DS.
What makes you HAPPY?

I finally found a new dance studio! I take jazz/tap on monday nights, and its really fun. I'm so excited to get back into it! I'll also be TEACHING dance at the daycare this summer if I have the time (hoping that I find a new job), which is AWESOMESAUCE. I've been working out trying to get back into shape, and I'm feeling really good. Only 224 hours left at school. THANK GOODNESS!

My week started out AWESOME.  I had a great review at work, got a .50 raise, sang karaoke to Dad for his birthday tuesday night with Amanda, and had a meeting with a personal trainer so that I know what exercises to do regularly.

The weekend has been chill, which is nice.  Went to the gym yesterday, then hung out with Tara and Angie.  Cleaning today, then going out with Nick down in Newport.  :)


I miss Robin.  :(

I saw Twilight with Jimmy on saturday, and I actually did like it.  I didn't think I would when it first came out (sorry Amber!), but it was groovy.  I'd like to find time to read the books, because I hear they are even better.  I just started a new book, so maybe after this one.  I also saw Friday the 13th this past weekend, and it was a good slasher flick.  Hadn't seen one in awhile.

I may be taking a road trip at the end of March with Hannah to see Davy Jones AND Micky Dolenz!  We'd be going to NJ, then PA, then NY, all in one weekend.  Awesomesauce!  I haven't been on a road trip since last year when we went to Chicago to see Micky, so I REALLY hope I can go.  Money is the only issue.  I need a new pair of shears, but those cost $200 and up...so that may have to wait until after this trip.

Just because:
<center><lj-embed id="18"/>

Happy Singles Awareness Day to everyone!

<center><lj-embed id="17"/>

I had to leave the Salon. I wasn't comfortable being paid under the table. It is illegal. Luckily, I was able to go back to my 2 days at the daycare. I can't wait to finish school and get a full time job. Winter time in Ohio is a real drag. The crazy white death kept me out of school all last week, and one day this week. I also missed school yesterday and work today because of the gnarly flu bug I caught sometime last weekend. What made my week a little bit awesome? Buying this groovy 1966 Monkees poster!
It was only $15 with shipping. I've been good and gotten all of my bills in order (except for that crazy school loan, which is going to take awhile) and have built my bank account up a little. I'm hopefully going to save enough for Davy Jones' show in May and a trip to NYC with the sister this summer. Yay for an exciting year! *hopefully...* Amber - I also knew Jin couldn't be dead...and I knew that was Danielle as soon as they started speaking French. We're magic Lost mindfreaks. I still have a lovecrush on Sayid.
I also saw that your away message said you were watching ABDC. I FUCKIN' love that show. Ringmasters severely angered me. Where is the dancing, guys?!?! I'm rootin' for Beat Freaks and Quest Crew.

I now work in a salon as a receptionist, and its good to watch the stylists on the job.  I hope I learn a lot from them while I'm there.

I REALLY need to catch up on some sewing.

What the fuck, Ringo Starr??  I want to see this.

<lj-embed id="16"/>
I will start DANCING again this year.

<center><lj-embed id="15"/></center>

Refrain: Riu, riu, chiu (nightingale's sounds)
The river bank protects it,
As God kept the wolf
from our lamb.
Refrain: Riu, riu, chiu...

The rabid wolf tried to bite her,
But God Almighty knew how to defend her,
He wished to create her impervious to sin,
Nor was this maid to embody original sin.
Refrain: Riu, riu, chiu...

The newborn child is the mightiest monarch,
Christ patriarchal invested with flesh.
He made himself small and so redeemed us:
He who was infinite became finite.
Refrain: Riu, riu, chiu...

Many prophecies told of his coming,
And now in our days have we seen them fulfilled.
God became man, on earth we behold him,
And see man in heaven because he so willed.
Refrain: Riu, riu, chiu...

Finished my Christmas shopping yesterday. Hallelujah. The mall was like a madhouse, and I wanted to elbow some people in the ribcage. Holiday spirit ahoy! Mom got 2 Yankee Candles, Amanda got Get Smart on DVD and a handmade purse, and Dad got a $50 gift card to Outback Steakhouse. He is hard to shop for. I hope everyone has a happy holiday, whatever you may celebrate.

28 years ago today, John Lennon was taken away from us.
October 9, 1940 - December 8, 1980
Don't get caught up in commercialism, Charlie Brown.

Cupcakes = Beauty school drugs.

I get to sleep in 2 days in a row.  Hallelujah.

I have figured out one of the greatest mysteries of life. Why do you never see Charlie Brown's parents?...because they were drugged-out alcoholic hippies. Why else would one child be bald, while his sister has Spirograph bangs? Makes sense to me.
Did you know Charles M. Schultz invented Spirograph? Me either. Genius.

472 hours left at Tri-county Beauty College.

Our house is now Christmas-ized, thanks to my Mom being home sick today.  Apparently, she is over Thanksgiving already.  A lot of deviled eggs will have to be made in a few weeks.

I voted today, first time ever.  Way to be patriotic, Charlotte!  I promised the girls at school that WHEN Obama wins, I will make Obama cupcakes for thursday.  I think they're addicted to my baking...its like drugs.

After tomorrow, I will be certified in Microderm Abrasion.  Anyone need to remove the top layer of skin from their face?  I can totally help you out.  I just have to take the test. I'm at 7 1/2 hours, and its 8 hours to get your certification...so another 1/2 hour of test-taking.

Trader's World on sunday was groovy.  I hadn't hung out with Mom and Amanda in awhile, + Corey and Robin showed up!  Eating greasy flea market pizza is not a good idea, your stomach will hate you for it.  These 2 dudes always have cool Monkees (and sometimes Beatles) suprises for me.  

Hope everyone enjoyed election day!  <3
Peace & Love.

"When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace." - Jimi Hendrix

Home sick with Strep. Bizzored. Lurking the intranets. Might start another sewing project today. I guess thats the only good thing about sick days...you can get some shit done at home. Television sucks. Found the BEST halloween costume. Get ready for it on friday, people who will be in Blue Ash. <3
Might go see Micky Dolenz again next month. He'll be about an hour away, at a casino. Awesomesauce. :)

Trying on clothes is a HUGE drag.  Nothing ever fits right.  Trying to find a dress for my halloween costume is an even BIGGER drag.  Bleh.  I don't know if I'm going to be able to pull off the Edie costume, because 1. I can't pull an outfit together, and 2. I keep thinking about how much I don't look like her in the weight area, and it makes me feel like shit.  This is my most favorite time of year, and I'm starting to feel like I just don't even want to dress up.  The prices on costumes at the halloween superstores are outrageously high, and poorly made!  What to do, what to do?

If I get one more bitchy client at school, I'm going to explode.

Most played song on my iPod at the moment:
<center><lj-embed id="13"/>

I am now addicted to sewing.  I am working on my first shirt resizing, and I have so many other ideas floating through my head.  Love you Robin!  <3

I didn't do shit this weekend except sit at home, download tunes, and sew/knit.  A little lonely...

It is not normal for one person to have so much drainage in their sinuses.  Gross, I know, but true.  I'm in-human.  Now Amanda is also sick, so we'll probably keep passing it back and forth to each other for weeks.  Yay for season changes!  Blech.

I'm slacking on my knitting.  I keep wanting to work on it, but I feel like poop so I just lay down instead.  I need to take a field trip to the thrift stores to find fabric so I can start working on Christmas gifts.  Hopefully I can get some things done this week when my head clears up.

2008 is almost over.  Is there anything else amazing we can do before the year ends, guys?  Ashley, Chelle, Robin...anything?  We definitely need to plan juice box night.

Lets enjoy how adorable Davy Jones is with the cast of "Oliver!" in 1964 on the Ed Sullivan show:
<center><lj-embed id="12"/></center>
Makes me feel better!

Of course, I would catch the flu bug goin' around.  Poo poo.

Fairfield Community Center at Village green offers friday night ballroom dancing classes.  Whos with me on this?  I've always wanted to do it, since I started taking adult classes at my old studio.  LETS DANCE!

Bad news:  My bank has royaly fucked me.  Sprinkles has Irritable Bowel Syndrome.

Good news:  I finished my first sewing project (with the help of Master Robin)!  Back to work/school full time.  Halloween party time is almost here (STILL need to find stuff for my costume).  Payday friday, and I get a paycheck!

I did a facial at school today, and the woman said that I did a better job than the Aveda salon she usually goes to.  Yay for a confidence boost!  I think massage will be what I want to get into after school.

We had no power for nearly 24 hours at my house.  My sister and I played Disney Monopoly for quite some time, and she kicked my ass at it and took all my money everytime.  Boo on her!  Before going to bed, Mom, Amanda, and I played flashlight tag, and then Mom and Amanda played Burglars and pretended to rob out kitchen.  We are a fun times family, lemme tell ya.  Our power came back on today, and Amanda, Granny, and I wanted to go get a sandwich somewhere.  Every restaurant in our part of town was closed, so we went down by Forest Park to McDonalds.  EVERYONE in the area was there, and the staff looked so frazzled, I felt sorry for them.  Well, I ordered a chicken sandwich, got a completely different sandwich, went up to have it fixed, and they forgot about it.  I asked for my money back, and the manager gave me a coupon for a free value meal, the correct sandwich, and my money back!  Yay for McDonalds under pressure.  I didn't have to work today because the daycare has no power, and that kinda pissed me off, because today was my first full day going back from 9-6, and I need to get paid!  Hopefully the power is on out at school so I can go tomorrow.  I hope everyone who still doesn't have power gets it back soon, and I also hope nobody was hurt in the storm yesterday with all of the trees/ power lines that went down.  <3

I haven't watched The Monkees in forever.  Gosharooney, I love this show.

<center><lj-embed id="11"/>

I've calmed down a bit since my last post...but only a bit. I still feel like I'm distanced from some of the people I used to be close to. I've been stuck in a depression since my surgery, possibly since before that, and I'm trying my best to get out of it. I enjoy being optomistic and cheerful, and I try to think about all that I have to be thankful for and that cheers me up, but being at home so much left with nothing but your thoughts can really bum you out! I know people grow apart as years go by, and I guess thats just something that you have to accept when it happens. Going to the ER last night didn't help my bummer-mood either, and I'm going to go insane being at the hospital so much. Everyone that is healthy and doesn't have any chronic or major health complications...BE THANKFUL. I go back to my normal schedule next week, so maybe that will get me out of this funk. I enjoy living by my own "peace and love" theory, no matter what anyone thinks or says, so I need to remember that!

I am not a confrontational person.  I don't like fighting, tension, or hatrid.  I usually try to get along with everyone and when someone is mean/starts shit/is aggravating, I let it slide and forgive way too easily.  Lately, it seems like I should start being a little bit more bitchy when it comes to people.  If someone is a complete douchebag/rude ass/dumb fuck, then I really don't want to be around them.  I just get quiet and aggravated and wait to leave.  I don't think that you shouldn't be friends with someone just because you have different views on things than they do, and I have a lot of friends that do things I'm not into, and I do things they aren't really psyched about.  I just feel like I need to draw a line at what to tolerate and what not to.  I don't want to be judgemental or seem like a snobby bitch, but I'd rather sit at home alone then hang out somewhere and feel really out of place and just be pissed off.  I don't want any of my friends who read this to think that I'm bitching about them personally, its a mix of different people that I just don't want to be around.

The reason I'm so quiet around a lot of peole is because I'm shy as fuck.  If I don't know you, then I probably won't start yackin' a mile a minute to you right off the bat unless I am intoxicated.  I keep to myself.  Mainly, because I get WAY TOO self-concious and think that anything that I say around someone I don't know is going to sound retarded, and they are going to think I'm a dumbass.  I have to warm up to people before I can have real conversations with them most of the time.  I'm working on trying to be more talkative to new people so that I don't come off as a snob mcgee, but it takes time and it isn't easy for me to open up so quickly.  I want to meet new people and make new friends, so I'm trying my damndest to be personable and friendly.

Have I bitched enough?  Probably.

I don't seem to understand people much anymore.

Halloween costume for 2008:
Edie Sedgwick. I know that I'm not skinny or as GORGEOUS (or crazy) as her, but I'd like to try and pull of her look.

Tomorrow is the big day o' surgery.  I'm super duper nervous.  I'm used to the hospital, needles, blah blah...I'm nervous about being put under and sliced open.  Thank god I'll be out of it for a good day afterwards.  I apologize now for all the druggy text messages I'm going to send to everyone.

I've seen 4 movies in the past 2 weeks, 2 of which were free.  Thats more than I've probably seen the entire rest of this year.  Awesomesauce.

I'm getting ready to head out for a fun day of sister bonding with Amanda.  Woot woot.

Surgery one week from today.  Bummersauce on extreme levels.  Only plus side:  being lazy for a few weeks at home, reading and drawing and watching movies.  Whoever would like to join me for lazy/art/movie madness at Shobe Hospital, drop me a line.  I wanted to try and hit up Kings Island before surgery so I could ride some rides, but I don't think I planned ahead well enough for that one. If you go after 5 p.m., its only $15! 

Robin taught me how to knit, and it is super rad.  I'm excited to learn how to make groovy crafts like she does.  Stitch n' Bitch parties are the best.  Also, Apples to Apples nights at Pearl's are the best x2.  "Touchy Feely..at my parents house..."  Oh, Renasty!

1 MORE DAY UNTIL MICKY DOLENZ!!!

I met with the surgeon, and my surgery will be the week after saturday August 9th. Damn straight I'm still going to see MD. 3rd row seats!!! HELLZYES. The surgery isn't as serious as I was once lead to believe. They're going to do a bypass, and connect my stomach to my colon to bypass the duodenum where the strictures are. Only a few days in the hospital, about a month of recovery if all goes well. The red is what they are bypassing. The purple is what they are connecting (not the large intestine, the small underneath of it.)
Robin is awesomesauce. Just wanted to share.

I meet with the surgeon on wednesday at 2 pm.

Fun List : (posted April 13, 2008)
x Holiday Auto Theater 
x Traders World
- Doobie Bros./Chicago Concert
x Park Walks/Picnics
+ Micky Dolenz Concert!
+ Journey/Heart/Cheap Trick Concert

x = already done!
- = missed
+ = hasn't happened yet


I have to meet with a surgeon.  I already bought my MD tickets, so I hope I can still go see him.  Its only 2 weeks away!  I don't know how soon the surgeon will want to do the surgery, but hopefully it can wait awhile...I've gone this long with my messed up bowels, it can go another few weeks.  My first surgery was put off for nearly 6 months (I was in 7th grade, and they waited until summer break so I didn't miss any school), so 2 weeks is nothin'!  Plus, I'm super scared for this surgery...so I'm in no rush...
I have the most phenomenal friends in the world.  LOVE.
